resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

wesm commented on issue #4524: ARROW-3052: [C++] Detect Apache ORC C++ libraries in system/conda toolchain, add to conda requirements
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4524#issuecomment-501112209
 
 
   Also it appears some package rebuilds with updated version pins may be needed in conda-forge:
   
   ```
   UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
     - grpc-cpp
     - orc -> libprotobuf[version='>=3.5.2,<3.6.0a0']
   Use "conda search <package> --info" to see the dependencies for each package.
   ```

kou commented on pull request #4524: ARROW-3052: [C++] Detect Apache ORC C++ libraries in system/conda toolchain, add to conda requirements
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4524#discussion_r294531097
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/manylinux1/build_arrow.sh
 ##########
 @@ -90,6 +90,7 @@ PATH="${CPYTHON_PATH}/bin:${PATH}" cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release \
     -DARROW_GANDIVA_JAVA=OFF \
     -DBoost_NAMESPACE=arrow_boost \
     -DBOOST_ROOT=/arrow_boost_dist \
+    -DORC_SOURCE=BUNDLED \  # ARROW-3052
 
 Review comment:
   We can't put comment here because it breaks continuous line by `\`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: See https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake#L155. After the CMake refactor it is possible to use built ORC packages with {{$ORC_HOME}} but not detected like the other toolchain dependencies

comments.body: I'm adding support for Thrift for ARROW-3050
I think we are mostly there on this. We don't have ORC in conda-forge yet, though
I just repurposed this issue to be about fixing ORC to pull from the system (or conda) toolchain since that's the only thing left
